page.title: 01HARPUR TRUST SCHOOLS
page.content: {Education}is a unique industry on which Bedford built and capitalised, and it is one which is still thriving. {The Harpur Trust,}a registered charity founded in 1566 by Sir William Harpur, derives income from an estate in Holborn, London. There are four schools;{Bedford}and{Bedford Modern for boys,{Bedford High}and{Dame Alice {Harpur}for girls. Each occupies a large site in Bedford, with a mixture of old and modern buildings. The schools employ 750 people directly, many others indirectly. The total number of pupils is 4200, comprising of boarders and day pupils. Pupils ages range from 7-18.
